concise_definition: n. 季节, 时节; v. 调味, 使适应季节

definitions.explanation_en: One of the four main periods of the year (spring, summer, autumn, winter), characterized by distinct weather patterns, daylight length, and natural phenomena.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一年中的四个主要时期之一（春、夏、秋、冬），以独特的天气模式、日照时长和自然现象为特征。
definitions.example_en: Autumn is my favorite season because of the colorful leaves and cool breezes.
definitions.example_cn: 秋天是我最喜欢的季节，因为树叶五彩斑斓，微风凉爽。

definitions.explanation_en: A period of time during which a particular activity or event is most common or popular, often tied to cultural or economic cycles.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某种活动或事件最常见或最流行的一段时期，通常与文化或经济周期相关。
definitions.example_en: The holiday shopping season begins in November.
definitions.example_cn: 假日购物季从十一月开始。

definitions.explanation_en: To add spices, herbs, or salt to food to enhance its flavor.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过添加香料、香草或盐来提升食物的味道。
definitions.example_en: Make sure to season the chicken well before grilling.
definitions.example_cn: 烤鸡之前一定要充分调味。

definitions.explanation_en: To mature or adapt something over time, especially through exposure to experience or environment; often used metaphorically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过时间或环境的磨砺使某物成熟或适应，常用于比喻意义。
definitions.example_en: After years in the courtroom, she became a seasoned lawyer.
definitions.example_cn: 经过多年的法庭历练，她成为了一名经验丰富的律师。

comparison.analysis: “Period”（时期）是一个更广泛、更中性的术语，泛指任何时间段，不带有季节性、周期性或自然规律的含义。而 “season” 特指与自然节律或社会惯例紧密相关的周期性时段，如四季或节日季。
“Spice”（香料）是名词，指具体的调味品，如胡椒、肉桂等；而 “season” 作为动词时，指使用这些香料进行调味的行为或过程。前者是材料，后者是动作或效果。
“Climate”（气候）指一个地区长期的平均天气状况，是宏观、统计性的概念；而 “season” 是气候中可感知的短期变化阶段。气候决定季节的特征，但季节是气候的外在表现形式。
